column4: Can some one help me , Sudo has stopped working  ('Myusername" is not in the sudoers file. This incident will be reported.'
what is the output of « groups »
sorry iam a newb what do u mean ?
run « groups » in a terminal and tell me the output
ok ill do that
Jrib: ok its say myusername dip
so the next question is: have you run some commands to modif the groups your user is in?
no way of noing it was sum1 elses doing lol
huh?
iam speaking for some else . some1 told him to run this command:
sudo usermod -G dip USERNAME
why?  that command removes the user from all of his groups
no idea , any way for him to reverse it
reboot, choose "recovery mode" from the grub menu, add your user back to the default groups (syntax: sudo adduser USER GROUP)
erm, you can drop the "sudo"
thanks alot
what must the group name b
the default ones.  Create a new fresh user and copy those
o ok i see thanks
« adduser FOOBAR » will create the user named FOOBAR
